definitions.definition: a game played over a large area of ground using sticks with a special shape to hit a small hard ball (a golf ball) into a series of 9 or 18 holes, using as few shots as possible

examples.text: He enjoyed a **round of golf** on a Sunday morning.
Choose from over 100 golf packages in our brochure.
His coach says his golf swing needs improving.
She has a golf handicap of 18.
This is one of the most famous golf tournaments in the world.
The club is holding a golf clinic next week, where golfers can get advice from the pros.
The eighth at Banff is one of the world's great golf holes.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (originally Scots): perhaps related to Dutch kolf ‘club, bat’, used as a term in several Dutch games; golf, however, is recorded before these games.
